# accessibilityElement(children:)

**Instance Method**

Creates a new accessibility element, or modifies the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AccessibilityChildBehavior] of the existing accessibility element.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated func accessibilityElement(children: AccessibilityChildBehavior = .ignore) -> some View

```

## Parameters

- **children**: The behavior to use when creating or transforming an accessibility element. The default is [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AccessibilityChildBehavior/ignore]

## Discussion

See also:

- [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AccessibilityChildBehavior/ignore]
- [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AccessibilityChildBehavior/combine]
- [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AccessibilityChildBehavior/contain]

## Creating accessible elements

- **accessibilityChildren(children:)**: Replaces the existing accessibility element’s children with one or more new synthetic accessibility elements.
- **accessibilityRepresentation(representation:)**: Replaces one or more accessibility elements for this view with new accessibility elements.
- **AccessibilityChildBehavior**: Defines the behavior for the child elements of the new parent element.
